Description: Central part of a corroded iron hook of rectangular cross-section, with a straight shank; point and eye are broken and missing
Curator's comments: Part of one of the fish-hooks "exactly like those of Naukratis" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 14 (with both ends subsequently lost). The Museum register mentions another iron fish-hook 23979 (1887,0101.1501) not found. Other fish-hooks from Tell Dafana in Boston, MFA, 87.505, 87.506.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 14)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.77, p.185, pl.27)
